timeline.message: Enable filtering $lastn operation by Observation effective date.
Enable filtering $lastn operation by Observation effective date.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'remotes/origin/master' into im_2020601_lastn_code_text_filter

# Conflicts:
#	hapi-fhir-jpaserver-base/src/test/java/ca/uhn/fhir/jpa/search/lastn/LastNElasticsearchSvcMultipleObservationsIT.java
Add support for partial code description matching.
Add close method for Elasticsearch service. Fix the partial code match.
Add documentation and remove requirement for max parameter (defaulted to 1 now).

timeline.bodyText: All these strings should probably be ripped into constants
timeline.author: tadgh

replies.bodyText: Done (along with other similar constants in this class).
replies.author: IanMMarshall

timeline.bodyText: What is this calculation doing? Consider ripping the math out into a constant that explains the purpose
timeline.author: tadgh

replies.bodyText: The idea here was to generate a new and distinct observation effective date time for each Observation by subtracting a calculated and unique offset value from a constant Date value. To make this more clear,  I have moved this coding into a separate method, broken up the calculation and added some comments.
replies.author: IanMMarshall
